title: How to Make Milk‐Free Sugar Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 ̊ Fahrenheit (175 ̊ Celsius).
Cover two baking sheets with parchment or aluminum paper.
Combine the dry ingredients together in a large bowl.
steps.description: Mix the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt with a whisk. Set aside for later use.

steps.headline: In a separate large bowl, cream the shortening and sugar together.
steps.description: Use an electric mixer to blend the ingredients together for about two minutes until the mixture is well-creamed.

steps.headline: Crack in the egg and add the vanilla extract.
steps.description: Blend once more until the ingredients fully combine.

steps.headline: Slowly pour in the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Blend slowly on low speed until the ingredients incorporate together and form a doughy texture.

steps.headline: Form the cookie dough into balls and place them on the tray.
steps.description: Using a mini ice cream scoop, scoop out the dough and shape the dough into balls. Roll them in extra sugar and set them aside on the baking sheets, at least two inches away from each other. If the cookie dough is too dry to roll into balls, add two tablespoons of soy milk into the dough to help create a more dough-like consistency.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for about 10-11 minutes.
steps.description: Allow the cookies to bake until the tops begin to slightly crack and the edges turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool for about 10 minutes.
steps.description: Set aside until the cookies are warm enough to touch.

text: Preheat the oven to 350 ̊ Fahrenheit (175 ̊ Celsius).  Cover two baking sheets with parchment or aluminum paper. Set aside for later use. Combine the dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Mix the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt with a whisk. Set aside for later use. In a separate large bowl, cream the shortening and sugar together. Use an electric mixer to blend the ingredients together for about two minutes until the mixture is well-creamed. Crack in the egg and add the vanilla extract. Blend once more until the ingredients fully combine. Slowly pour in the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Blend slowly on low speed until the ingredients incorporate together and form a doughy texture. Form the cookie dough into balls and place them on the tray. Using a mini ice cream scoop, scoop out the dough and shape the dough into balls. Roll them in extra sugar and set them aside on the baking sheets, at least two inches away from each other. If the cookie dough is too dry to roll into balls, add two tablespoons of soy milk into the dough to help create a more dough-like consistency. Bake the cookies for about 10-11 minutes. Allow the cookies to bake until the tops begin to slightly crack and the edges turn golden brown. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool for about 10 minutes. Set aside until the cookies are warm enough to touch. Serve and enjoy!
